name: Lasagne
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add ground beef and pork. Cook until browned, breaking up the meat with a spoon.
5. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
6. Simmer the sauce for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Adjust seasoning as needed.
7. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat for the cheese sauce.
8. Stir in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes to form a roux.
9. Gradually whisk in milk, ensuring no lumps form. Cook until the sauce thickens.
10. Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Mix until smooth.
11. Cook the lasagne noodles according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and lay them out on a baking sheet.
12. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
13. Spread a thin layer of meat sauce on the bottom of a baking dish.
14. Place a layer of lasagne noodles over the sauce.
15. Spread a portion of cheese sauce over the noodles.
16. Repeat layers, ending with a layer of cheese sauce on top.
17. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan and shredded mozzarella.
18. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
19. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the top is golden and bubbly.
20. Let the lasagne rest for at least 15 minutes before serving.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking up the meat with a spoon.
5. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine (if using), beef broth, oregano, basil, sugar, salt, and pepper.
6. Simmer the sauce for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Adjust seasoning as needed.
7. While the sauce is simmering, cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
8. Toss the cooked spaghetti with the Bolognese sauce, or serve the sauce over the spaghetti.
9. Garnish with fresh basil or parsley and grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.
